trans-unit.target: TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The fretful Arkasodara seeks someone to brave the wilderness.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_TODO_00<tab>Search for the wizened Arkasodara to the north of Palaka's Stand.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the wizened Arkasodara.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_TODO_02<tab>Collect the fish.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_TODO_03<tab>Deliver the fish to the wizened Arkasodara.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_TODO_04<tab>Speak with the fretful Arkasodara.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_000<tab>I've heard about all the good you've done for our village, and we're all thankful for it. I hate to impose upon your generosity further, but if you have a moment to spare, could you lend me your stout arm?

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_001<tab>I would ask you to search for my father. I haven't seen him for bells, and after asking around it seems he may have left the village and ventured north.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_002<tab>The divinities only know why he went alone, but if I were to follow him I'd likely end up at the bottom of some beast's belly within a malm. Please, find him and return him safely to our home.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_003<tab>Please, bring my father back. He's even less of a fighter than I am!
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_005<tab>Oh, thank the heavens! I had resigned myself to becoming food for those dreadful things!

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_006<tab>What's that? My daughter sent you to find me? I thought no one saw me leave the village, but I suppose I am not so sly as I thought. And now I've caused her, and you, no end of worry.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_007<tab>The number of people fleeing to our village increases by the day, and although I would never begrudge them protection, it does put a strain on our food supplies. I took up my old fishing equipment hoping I could make some small contribution.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_008<tab>Children need hearty meals to grow, after all. Filling our stores is the least I can do to ease us through these troubled times. Think you could help this old fool on his errand?

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_009<tab>Your generosity is much appreciated. I've already set up several cages near the water. All you have to do is check them and bring me anything they've caught.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_010<tab>I've set up cages around the river. See if they've caught anything, and if so, bring it here.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_015<tab>I trust the river wasn't too cold for you. So, what'd you find? I hope my fishing skills haven't gone rusty in my old age.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_016<tab>Ah, that's what I like to see. Plump and juicy, just what we need. This'll keep the refugees fed for another day, I reckon.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSB04264_000_017<tab>And that's how we have to get through this: one day at a time. All right, let's return to my daughter. I'm sure she's had her fill of worry on my account.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_020<tab>I've been waiting for you! My father returned and told me about all you did for him and for our village. It seems I owe you thanks for two good deeds today.

TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_021<tab>Palaka's Stand has long been a place where the stewards of the shrines and tombs resided. That's to say, we've been focused mainly on meeting the needs of the departed, not the living.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_022<tab>As such, I understand my father's desire to see our food stores bolstered, but if he gets himself killed, we'll all be worse off for it.
TEXT_AKTKZF009_04264_RESIDENTSA04264_000_023<tab>Thankfully, we needn't worry about that. For today, at least. Take this as a gesture of gratitude from both Father and I.
